content.rendered:
Pancha Dwaraka Tour Package

Home » India » Gujarat » Pancha Dwaraka Tour Package

Tour Overview

A Pancha Dwarka pilgrimage will refresh the spirit and take you back in the corridors of time till you reach a rich magical era where Lord Krishna shines with his glory and power. For any religiously inclined Hindu or Vaishnav the Panch Dwarka Tour is a stepping stone in the path of enlightenment.

The Pancha Dwarka circuit covers 5 major magnificent temples; Dwarkadhish temple in Dwarka, Ranchhodraiji temple in Dakor, Shrinathji temple in Nathdwara, Bet Dwarka temple near Dwarka and Dwarkadhish temple in Kankroli. A Panch Dwarka trip takes one around the culturally rich frontiers of Gujarat and Rajasthan.

Gujarat and its people will overwhelm you with their warmth and hospitality as you will discover when you join Namaste India Trip Pvt. Ltd. Pancha Dwarka Tour lasting all of 9 nights and 10 days starting at Ahmedabad.

Pancha Dwaraka Tour Itinerary Package

Day 1 :Ahmedabad – Dwarka (430km/8Hours)

Arrive in Ahmedabad to a warm welcome by Namaste India Trip tour representative who escorts you to the waiting coach that will take you on the 8 hours overnight drive to Dwarka. Check into hotel in the morning.

Day 2 :Dwarka Sightseeing

Breakfast on typical Saurashtra fare. Set out for a day-long sightseeing tour. First off we visit Dwarkadheesh Temple. Next is Rukmini temple, dedicated to Lord Krishna’s Wife. Then it is a brief visit to Bet Dwarka also known as Shankoddar, an island off the Saurashtra coast. Then visit Ranchodrai temple and the Matsya Avatar Temple followed by the Nageshwar temple, one of the 12 jyotirlingas in India. Day ends. Retire for the night to your comfortable room.

Day 3 :Dwarka – Porbandar – Somnath (234Km/4Hours)

Morning breakfast over ghee group boards the coach for the 234 km drive to Somnath that will take 4 hours. However, the drive is punctuated by stops at Tara Mandir Planetarium and then stop at Porbandar to visit Kirti Mandir, home of Mahatma Gandhi followed by a visit to the temple of Sudama, Lord Krishna’s friend, and devotee and then take a brief walk along the Chowpatty beach to view the Huzoor Mahal. Board the coach once again for onward drive to Somnath. Check into your hotel room on arrival. Freshen up and set out to Bhalka tirth where, it is said, Lord Krishna was shot in the foot by an arrow. Here the group visits a Sun temple. Then we go to the main attraction-the famed Somnath Temple that was looted several times for its hoards of gold. One of the four char dhams in India, Somnath is the site of one of the 12 jyotirlingas. The evening is reserved for the sound and light show. Return to your room for the night.

Day 4 :Somnath – Rajkot (225Km)

After breakfast, everyone gets on board the coach for the 225 km drive to Rajkot, punctuated by stops at Junagadh and Gondal, all princely cities of Saurashtra. In Junagadh group visits Uparkot Fort, within whose precincts you will find Adi Kadi Vav, a stepwell, the Buddhist Caves and Navghan Kuvo or well. From Junagadh, the coach takes you to Gondal, also a princely city where we visit the Swaminarayan temple. Arrive in Rajkot finally and check into your hotel for the night.

Day 5 :Rajkot – Lothal – Dakor – Ahmedabad

A typical Kathiawari breakfast over, you board the coach for the drive to Ahmedabad. The first stop on the way is at Lothal, an ancient historic site that was home to a flourishing Harappan civilization about 4500 years ago. View the artifacts in the Museum here and then proceed to Dakor, visited by lakhs of pilgrims traveling by foot to the Shree Ranchhodraiji temple here. Then, finally, arrive in Ahmedabad and check into your hotel for the night. Explore night life of Ahmedabad by visiting Manek Chowk to snack on bhel puri and gol gappa.

Day 6 :Ahmedabad – Matru Gaya – Ambaji

Breakfast over, the group boards the coach for the drive to Ambaji. On the way, there is a stop at Siddhpur, also known as Matru Gaya. Proceed to Ambaji, one of the 51 Shakti peethas in India and have darshan at Ambaji Temple. The heart of Sati Devi is said to have fallen here. Check into a hotel on arrival and retire for the night.

Day 7 :Ambaji – Mount Abu

Breakfast and board the coach to proceed to Mount Abu. On the way we stop at Dilwara to view the magnificently superb Jain temple with their beautiful carvings in Marble. Then, arrive in Abu and stroll to the Nakki Lake for a brief boat ride. Visit Brahma Kumari Ashram and Guru Shikhar before retiring for the night.

Day 8 :Mount Abu – Udaipur (160Km)

Breakfast and get into the coach for the drive to Nathdwara and Udaipur. On arrival at Nathdwara, we visit the famous Shrinathji temple after which the cash proceeds to Kankroli temple where there is a temple of Lord Krishna. Finally, we arrive at Udaipur. Check into hotel. Freshen up and set out to explore this city of Lakes. The main attraction is the City Palace along with other palaces alongside Lake Pichola. Next, we visit Jagdish temple built by Maharaj Jagat Singh. After visiting the museum and other attractions, retire to your room and explore Udaipur in the evening on your own.

Day 9 :Udaipur – Ahmedabad (260km)

Breakfast before we proceed to Ahmedabad. Stop at Gandhinagar, capital of Gujarat to visit Akshardham. Proceed to Ahmedabad and check into a hotel for the night.

Day 10 :Ahmedabad Departure

Breakfast over, the tour ends and our tour guide bids you a fond farewell bringing the Pancha Dwarka Gujarat tour to a happy conclusion. You are helped to the airport or railway station.

Price Details

Tour Name Pancha Dwaraka Tour Package
Duration 10 Days / 9 Nights
Destinations Ahmedabad - Dwarka - Somnath
Tour Price On Request

Chat with specialist who can help plan your tour!

  • +91-971 1616 316

    Holiday Your Way with Namaste India Trip!

    Filling out the information form provided allows you to receive the best budget-friendly customized itinerary in just a few hours.

    • We assure the privacy of your contact data.

    • This data will only be used by our team to contact you and no other purposes.

    Trip Highlights

    • Dwarkadhish Dham Darshan
    • Homage at Rukmini Temple
    • Nageshwar Temple visit
    • Somnath temple visit
    • Visit the Tara Mandir Planetarium before continuing on to Porbandar to see the Kirti Mandir, Mahatma Gandhi's home.
    • V8isit to Junagadh and Godal
    • Ahmedabad sightseeing
    • Pay a visit to Matru Gaya Ambaji
    • Mount Abu and Udaipur excursion

    Package Inclusions

    • Pick up and drop transfers.
    • Hotel accommodation for 3 nights on the basis of twin sharing.
    • Annapurna conservation permit fees.

    Package Exclusions

    • All the personal expenses like laundry, tipping, entrance fees etc.
    • Extra charges during emergency evacuation in case of political unrest or some such situation.
    • Personal insurances like travel and personal etc.

    FAQs for Pancha Dwarka Package

    Q. What Is The Background Of Pancha Dwaraka?

    A. It is one of Rajasthan's Panch Dwarka temples. On the orders of Maharana Raj Singh of Mewar, Goswami priest built this temple in 1672. Udaipur is about 48 kilometers northeast of here. It contains the original black marble Shrinathji idol from Govardhan.

    Q. What Is The Meaning Of Panch Dwarka?

    A. Dwarka, Bhalka Tirth near Somnath, Dakorji, Shamlaji (in Gujarat), and Shrinathji (near Udaipur in Rajasthan) are all part of Panch Dwarka.

    Q. What Is Dwarka's Secret?

    A. Dwarka, an ancient Indian city, is said to have sunk beneath the Arabian Sea. Underwater archaeologists are now searching for the foundations of its city walls in order to prove its existence. Dwarka, one of India's seven holy pilgrimage centres, is not only religiously significant, but also archaeologically significant.

    Q. Why Is Dwarka Submerged In The Sea?

    A. Dwarka, an ancient Indian city, is known in Hindu culture as the great and beautiful city of Krishna. According to Hindu writings, the age of Kali began when Krishna left the Earth to join the spiritual world, and Dwarka and its inhabitants were submerged by the sea.

    Q. In Dwarka, Which River Meets The Sea?

    A. Krishna Ghat (Dwarka, India): The point at which the Gomati River meets the sea.
